summary: This is a Bank of America account statement for a joint account held by Leon D. Black and Debra Black, with Melanie Spinella listed as Power of Attorney. The statement shows significant financial activity in January 2011, including deposits of over $20 million and withdrawals of over $23 million, leaving an ending balance of approximately $848,411.77.

events.title: Bank Account Activity
events.description: Significant financial transactions occurred in a joint account held by Leon D. Black and Debra Black, including deposits of $20,724,721.06 and withdrawals totaling $23,171,592.73.

keyFacts: Leon D. Black and Debra Black held a joint Bank of America account (number ending 3840) with multi-million dollar transactions in January 2011.
Melanie Spinella was listed as the Power of Attorney (POA) for this account.
The account statement period was January 2011, showing a starting balance of $3,295,278.44, deposits over $20 million, withdrawals over $23 million, and an ending balance of $848,411.77.
The document is a financial record from the Epstein case files, indicating scrutiny of financial transactions related to key figures.
